B1 Lesson 2 – Lassen

lassen means 'to let' in German.
Conjugation:
ich lasse
du lässt
er/sie/es lässt
wir lassen
sie/Sie lassen

When is 'lassen' used?

'lassen' is used in three main situations:
1. nicht mitmachen – when you don't take part in something.
Example: Kann ich meine Koffer hier lassen? (Can I leave my suitcase here?)
2. Erlauben/nicht erlauben – when you give or refuse permission for someone to do something.
Example: Ich lasse mein Kind nicht fernsehen. (I don't let my child watch TV.)
3. nicht selbstmachen – when you let someone else do something for you.
Example: Ich lasse meine Haare schneiden. (I let my hair be cut.)

Permission Use Case – Rules for 'lassen'

Giving or not giving permission is the most common use of 'lassen'.
Rules:
1. 'lassen' is in second position.
2. The second verb moves to the end in infinitive form.
3. If there is a modal verb, modal is at second position, main verb at the end, and 'lassen' just before the end.
Examples:
She lets her brother play outside – Sie lässt ihren Bruder draußen spielen.
He doesn't let me speak – Er lässt mich nicht sprechen.
The teacher lets us ask questions – Der Lehrer lässt uns Fragen stellen.

I want to let my child play tennis – Ich will mein Kind Tennis spielen lassen.

Summary

'lassen' is used to:

  • not take part (nicht mitmachen)
  • give/refuse permission (erlauben/nicht erlauben)
  • let someone else do something (nicht selbstmachen)

Follow the word position rules for sentences with 'lassen', especially with other verbs and modals.
